text_paragraphs:
Application no. 58802/12
A.A.
against 
lodged on 11 September 2012

The applicant claims to be from Central Darfur and to belong in the paternal line to the ethnic group of the Fur and in the maternal line to the ethnic group of the Bergo. In  he has been politically active as member of the Sudanese Liberation Movement/Unit and the Darfur Peace and Development Centre (DFEZ).
Relying on Article 2 and 3 of the Convention the applicant fears that his deportation to  would expose him to the risk of being killed or ill-treated and tortured.
Relying on Article 13 of the Convention, the applicant claims that he does not have an effective remedy at national level to enforce his rights under Article 2 and 3 of the Convention.

In the light of the applicantâ€™s claims and the documents which have been submitted, would he face a risk of being subjected to treatment in breach of Article 3 of the Convention if the deportation order were enforced?
